text: statement of findings the general court hereby finds that whenever possible new hampshire adults should make their own decisions about how to live their lives the imposition of guardianship necessarily involves the loss of authority over one s own life adults with disabilities have a range of strengths and capacities and guardianship is unnecessarily restrictive in many of those circumstances guardianship may be necessary in some cases but when it is imposed upon a person with a disability that could utilize less restrictive alternatives it can cause negative impacts to mental and physical health and the ability to function independently supported is a process which preserves the of adults with disabilities by providing them with accommodations and supports to enable them to make life decisions supported has in recent years gained recognition and acceptance it has been promoted as an alternative to guardianship by the national guardianship association and the american bar association nine states have recently adopted statutes which formally establish supported agreements the legal recognition of supported will promote understanding and acceptance of the decisions of people with disabilities this will assist in effective relationships between people with disabilities and their caregivers health care providers and other third parties guardians and conservators available alternative resource rsa ii is repealed and reenacted to read as follows available alternative resource means alternatives to guardianship including but not limited to services such as visiting nurses homemakers home health aides adult day care and multipurpose senior citizen centers powers of attorney supported agreements such as those authorized by rsa representative and protective payees and board and care residential care facilities guardians and conservators termination of guardianship rsa i is repealed and reenacted to read as follows a guardianship of the person or of the estate shall terminate upon order of the court the death of the ward or upon a finding by the court either that the ward is no longer incapacitated or that the ward s needs are met by available alternative resources supported if adult guardianship is being discussed by the iep team with a student or the student s family the team shall inform the student and family of the availability of supported pursuant to rsa as an alternative to guardianship this shall be done promptly when guardianship is first discussed the iep team shall make available resources to assist in establishing a supported agreement if a supported agreement is executed the iep team shall abide by decisions made by the student pursuant to the supported agreement alternatives to guardianship information resources the commissioner of the department of education shall develop information resources regarding alternatives to guardianship including supported agreements pursuant to rsa for children with disabilities who are approaching the age of these resources shall be developed in consultation with new hampshire disability advocacy organizations and other stakeholders and made available to local education agencies to facilitate their responsibility to provide information to students and families regarding alternatives to guardianship under rsa new chapter supported amend rsa by inserting after chapter the following new chapter chapter supported purpose it is the purpose of this chapter to establish and recognize a less restrictive alternative to guardianship for adults with disabilities it fulfills this purpose by authorizing a legal option for adults with disabilities who seek assistance in making life decisions but choose to retain all of their legal rights the chapter gives legal status to supporters of such adults and to decisions made pursuant to supported construction and administration this chapter is to be administered and interpreted in accordance with the following principles all adults should be able to choose to live in the manner they wish and to accept or refuse support assistance or protection all adults should be able to be informed about and participate in the management of their affairs and the values beliefs wishes cultural norms and traditions that adults hold should be respected in supporting adults in the management of their affairs presumption of capacity all adults are presumed to be capable of managing their affairs and to have legal capacity the manner in which an adult communicates with others is not grounds for a determination that the adult is incapable of managing the adult s affairs execution of a supported agreement may not be used as evidence of incapacity in any proceeding the execution of a supported agreement does not preclude the adult who has entered into such an agreement from acting independently of the agreement definitions adult means an individual who is years of age or older disability means a physical or mental impairment that substantially limits one or more major life activities of a person immediate family member means a spouse child sibling parent grandparent grandchild stepparent stepchild or stepsibling person means an adult institution provider corporation partnership limited liability company association joint venture government governmental subdivision agency or instrumentality public corporation or any other legal or commercial entity principal means an adult who enters into a supported agreement under this chapter to receive assistance supported means a process of supporting and accommodating an adult with a disability to enable the adult to make life decisions including without limitation decisions related to where the adult wants to live the services supports and medical care the adult wants to receive whom the adult wants to live with education and where the adult wants to work without impeding the of the adult supporter means an adult who enters into an agreement with an adult with a disability to provide supported support services means a system of social and other services supplied by private state institutional or community providers designed to help maintain the independence of an adult including any of the following a services including house repair home cleaning laundry shopping and the provision of meals b services including transportation escort and facilitation of written oral and electronic communication c visiting nurse and attendant care d the provision of health care e physical and psychosocial assessments f legal assessments and advice g education and educational assessment and advice h personal treatment or care including assistance with activities of daily living such as bathing dressing eating range of motion toileting transferring and ambulation i care planning j other services needed to maintain the independence of an adult subject matter of agreement a principal may identify any type of decision to be the subject of an agreement under this chapter such matters may include but are not limited to physical and mental health care managing and using income and assets support services employment food and shelter assistance with public benefits education limitations of agreement an agreement under this chapter may coexist with but not conflict with a guardianship or other court order an agreement under this chapter may be for a definite term in the absence of a provision setting a definite term of the agreement the agreement shall remain in effect until terminated pursuant to rsa form and content of valid agreement in order to be valid under this chapter a supported agreement shall include all of the following a designation of at least one supporter b a description of the types of decisions for which the supporter is authorized to assist c a description of the types of decisions if any for which the supporter may not assist a supported agreement may include any of the following a designation of more than one supporter b provision for an alternate supporter to act in place of a supporter in circumstances specified in the agreement c authorization for a supporter to share information with any other person including another supporter a supported agreement is only valid if all of the following occur a the agreement is in a writing that contains the elements of the form contained in rsa c the agreement is dated d the agreement is signed in the presence of adult witnesses or before a notary public justice of the peace or commissioner of deeds e each party to the agreement has signed the agreement voluntarily and with an understanding of the nature and effect of the agreement the adult witnesses required by subparagraph iii d may not be any of the following a a supporter named in the agreement b an employee or agent of a supporter named in the agreement c a paid provider of services to the principal unless the person is an immediate family member d any person who does not understand the type of communication the principal uses unless an individual who understands the principal s means of communication is present to assist during the execution of the supported agreement a supported agreement shall contain a separate declaration signed by each supporter named in the agreement indicating all of the following a the supporter s relationship to the principal b the supporter s willingness to act as a supporter c the supporter s acknowledgment of the role of a supporter under this chapter termination of agreement a principal may terminate a supported agreement at any time such termination may be accomplished by any of the following actions by the principal a providing written notice to all of the supporters named in the agreement b verbally expressing the intent to terminate the agreement in the presence of adult witnesses a supporter may withdraw from a supported agreement by providing written notice to the principal if the principal does not use a written form of communication actual notice of the supporter s withdrawal shall be provided using the type of communication used by the principal when a supporter withdraws from a supported agreement and there is no remaining supporter the agreement is automatically terminated a supported agreement is automatically terminated upon the death of the principal subject to paragraph v a supported agreement is automatically terminated if any of the following events occur a there is a finding by a court or a state or federal agency that the principal has been abused neglected or exploited by a supporter named in the agreement b there is a criminal conviction of a supporter for any of the following offenses under new hampshire law or their equivalent in another jurisdiction any offense or attempted offense under rsa homicide any felony offense or attempted felony offense under rsa assault and related offenses any offense or attempted offense under rsa sexual assault and related offenses any offense or attempted offense under rsa robbery any offense or attempted offense under rsa theft any offense or attempted offense under rsa fraud any offense or attempted offense under rsa falsification in official matters when a supporter is the subject of a criminal conviction or a finding of misconduct under paragraph iv and there is one or more other supporters named in the agreement who are not the subjects of convictions or findings of misconduct under that paragraph the agreement does not automatically terminate however any supporter who is the subject of a criminal conviction or a finding of misconduct under paragraph iv is disqualified from further actions as a supporter under the agreement duties of supporters a supporter is in a fiduciary relationship with the principal and is subject to the following requirements to act loyally without and in good faith to act within the authority granted in the agreement and by this chapter to avoid conflicts of interest to disclose to the principal all facts known to the supporter relevant to making a decision to act with the care competence and diligence ordinarily exercised by individuals in similar circumstances with due regard either to the possession of or lack of special skills or expertise to provide sufficient information to a monitor for financial matters designated pursuant to rsa to allow the monitor to fulfill his or her responsibilities pursuant to this chapter authority of supporters a supporter may only exercise the authority granted to the supporter in the agreement a supporter is not a surrogate decision maker for the principal and is not authorized to sign legal or other documents on behalf of the principal or to bind the principal to a legal agreement a supporter may only access protected information if expressly authorized to do so by the principal in the agreement or other written document a supporter may not do any of the following a exert undue influence upon or make decisions on behalf of the principal b obtain without consent of the principal information that is not reasonably related to matters with which the supporter is authorized to assist under the supported agreement c use or disclose information without the principal s consent for a purpose other than assisting the principal to make decisions under the supported agreement recognition of supporters a decision or request made or communicated with the assistance of a supporter in conformity with this chapter shall be recognized for the purposes of any provision of law as the decision or request of the principal and may be enforced in law or equity on the same basis as a decision or request of the principal persons ineligible to be supporters any of the following are prohibited from acting as supporters a person who is an employer or employee of the principal unless the person is an immediate family member of the principal a person providing paid support services unless the person is an immediate family member of the principal a person against whom the principal has obtained an order of protection from abuse or a person who is the subject of a civil or criminal order prohibiting contact with the principal a person who has been convicted of any of the following new hampshire offenses or their equivalent in another jurisdiction if the offense has not been annulled a any offense or attempted offense under rsa homicide b any felony offense or attempted felony offense under rsa assault and related offenses c any offense or attempted offense under rsa sexual assault and related offenses d any offense or attempted offense under rsa robbery e any felony offense or attempted felony offense under rsa theft f any offense or attempted offense under rsa fraud g any offense or attempted offense under rsa falsification in official matters monitors for financial matters if a supporter is authorized in a supported agreement to assist a principal with his or her financial affairs a principal may designate a monitor a monitor designated under this section shall ensure that the supporter is complying with rsa and reporting of abuse and neglect if a person who receives a copy of a supported agreement or is aware of the existence of a supported agreement has cause to believe that the principal has been abused neglected or financially exploited by the supporter the person shall promptly report the alleged abuse neglect or exploitation to the commissioner of health and human services or the commissioner s authorized representative in accordance with rsa nothing in this section shall be construed as eliminating or limiting a person s requirement to report under any other statute or regulation access to information a supporter may assist the principal with obtaining any information to which the principal is entitled including with a dated specific consent executed by the principal protected health information under the health insurance portability and accountability act of public law educational records under the family educational rights and privacy act of u s section g or information related to a substance use disorder protected by u s section and f r part the supporter shall ensure all information collected on behalf of the principal under this section is kept privileged and confidential as applicable is not subject to unauthorized access use or disclosure and is properly disposed of when appropriate form of supported agreement a supported agreement may be in any form not inconsistent with the following form and the other requirements of this chapter use of the following form is presumed to meet statutory provisions supported agreement this agreement must be communicated to all
